learn.definition: Conflict is professional friction over competing project priorities (Time, Budget, Quality), not personal 'fighting'.
learn.context: Disagreements peak during the 'Storming' stage. PMs must facilitate the transition to 'Norming' to maintain velocity.
learn.path: Prioritize Collaboration (Win-Win). Compromise is a fallback. Force is for safety/legal emergencies only.
learn.boundary: Resolve peer-to-peer disputes internally. Do not escalate technical team conflicts to the Project Sponsor.

practice.mindset: Collaborate before you escalate. View conflict as a resource for uncovering hidden risks.
practice.enablers: Analyze Source & Stage // Determine Contextual Impact // Execute Resolution Technique.
practice.traps: NEVER escalate internal team squabbles. AVOID 'Smoothing' as a permanent fix for recurring issues.
practice.artifacts: Team Charter // Thomas-Kilmann Model // Conflict Log.

learn.definition: Leading is inspiring the team to achieve objectives through a shared vision and cultural alignment.
learn.context: Leadership styles must pivot (Servant, Situational, Transformational) based on team maturity levels.
learn.path: Adopt a Servant Leadership posture. Focus on removing blockers so the team can execute.
learn.boundary: Leadership is about people and motivation; Management is about control and task tracking.

practice.mindset: Empowerment over micromanagement. Trust is the primary currency of a high-performing team.
practice.enablers: Set Vision // Support Diversity & Inclusion // Inspire High Performance.
practice.traps: Avoid 'Command and Control' distractors. Never bypass team members to talk to functional managers.
practice.artifacts: Team Charter // RACI Matrix // Resource Management Plan.

learn.definition: Evaluating member performance and providing feedback to optimize overall project outcomes.
learn.context: Individual and team performance are measured against the Project Management Plan and Charter.
learn.path: Provide timely, constructive feedback focused on growth rather than purely on past mistakes.
learn.boundary: Handle individual issues privately; celebrate team wins publicly to maintain high morale.

practice.mindset: Performance is a continuous feedback loop, not a static end-of-quarter event.
practice.enablers: Appraise Performance // Verify Competencies // Reward Achievement.
practice.traps: Do not wait until the project end for feedback. Never ignore underperformance until it impacts the critical path.
practice.artifacts: Performance Appraisals // Training Records // Recognition Plan.

learn.definition: Granting teams the authority and resources to make decisions and take ownership of their work.
learn.context: Vital for Agile/Hybrid environments where self-organizing teams are a requirement for speed.
learn.path: Shift from 'Director' to 'Facilitator.' Delegating authority increases team speed and commitment.
learn.boundary: Empowerment requires 'Guardrails' (limits of authority) clearly defined in the Team Charter.

practice.mindset: Ownership drives results. The team should be autonomous within their defined scope.
practice.enablers: Delegate Authority // Support Self-Organization // Foster Individual Accountability.
practice.traps: Do not 'hover' or take back authority the moment a minor mistake is made.
practice.artifacts: Delegation Log // Skills Matrix // Agile Manifesto.

learn.definition: Identifying skill gaps and providing the necessary resources for team development.
learn.context: Training needs evolve as the project lifecycle moves from planning to execution.
learn.path: Budget for training early. Cross-training reduces the risk of 'Single Points of Failure'.
learn.boundary: Distinguish between 'Training' (tactical skills) and 'Mentoring' (long-term career growth).

practice.mindset: An upskilled team requires less supervision and produces higher quality output.
practice.enablers: Determine Training Needs // Allocate Budget // Verify Efficacy of Learning.
practice.traps: Don't assume all performance issues are training issues; check for tool or resource gaps first.
practice.artifacts: Skills Gap Analysis // Resource Management Plan // Training Certificates.

learn.definition: Bringing the right individuals together and fostering a cohesive, productive group dynamic.
learn.context: Success depends on understanding both technical chemistry and personality dynamics.
learn.path: Proactively move the team through Tuckmanâ€™s stages from Forming to Performing.
learn.boundary: Team building is an ongoing effort throughout the project, not a one-time social event.

practice.mindset: A unified team is your strongest defense against project complexity.
practice.enablers: Appraise Team Skills // Hire/Acquire Resources // Build Team Culture.
practice.traps: Avoid hiring 'brilliant jerks' who destroy team collaboration and morale.
practice.artifacts: Staffing Estimates // RAM/RACI Chart // Virtual Team Tools.
